Comment: Everything was quick and easy, something I didn‚Äôt understand about coverage and Jalol explained everything efficiently. Provided me with a roomier car.

Booked through Priceline and the final cost was much higher due to multiple add-ons that were not clearly explained at pickup. I declined insurance but was still charged because I didn‚Äôt provide a declarations page ‚Äî something that wasn‚Äôt communicated at the counter.It was impossible to get a clear combined breakdown of what I prepaid vs. what ACE charged. Make sure you review every line before signing.

They don‚Äôt contact you with any information after your booking then at the last minute inform you of policies you need to get the car. When you can‚Äôt meet the criteria because they did not inform you before hand, they won‚Äôt give you the car and then won‚Äôt refund your money. I‚Äôll never use them again. Very scammy and complete waste of my time and money. Go with someone more reputable

Was charged for a tiny chip in the low black corner windshield  section of our Kia soul rental. Pretty sure this was preexisting as we were cleared initially  and then Marco took out his flashlight after we walked away and starts yelling at us to come back. The tiny chip was very hard to see unless you shined a flashlight directly on it‚Ä¶ those rental lots are very dark - probably  on purpose. We drove the car less than 100 miles. Ace is charging our Insurance over $2000 to fix. And will not provide us a final repair invoice or proof it was even repaired. Probably not repairing it and going to pull the same scam. They also have you sign the sheet to mark down nicks as you are leaving and just say ‚Äúsign here‚Äù . We didn‚Äôt realize it was the sheet to mark down nicks,etc‚Ä¶  until it was too late. This is so completely scammy if you ask me‚Ä¶do not rent from ACE ever‚Ä¶.

Location: Wroc≈Çaw airport.Total scam. When I returned the car, they said everything was fine and I‚Äôd get my refund the next day. I called several times and they kept promising the money was coming. Then, out of nowhere, they messaged me claiming I damaged the car and demanding over ‚Ç¨1,000! Unbelievable and dishonest. Avoid them at all costs.

DONT BOOK WITH ACE RENT A CAR!!! SCAM ALERT!!!They scam their customers by forcing them to buy additional insurance they don‚Äôt need. First of all there is a shortage of rental cars on Maui. So I already paid a fortune to rent a car. Mine was $ 787.00 for a compact, 5 days. And on top of it they added ‚ÄûCollision‚Äú for $ 167.00 so the my grand total was $ 954.00.So here is the story. When I arrived there was nobody behind the counter and I was told to check in with a ‚Äúvirtual agent‚Äù. I walked over to the screen and talked to an agent via live chat ‚Äì Wow, what an experience. He asked me if I have coverage for rental cars with my insurance. I said yes and he demanded that I have to show proof. I took a screenshot of my ID car where it shows: Damage to rental cars is covered. So now he is demanding proof, that I have ‚ÄúCollision‚Äù on my policy. I am getting excited, stopped the conversation and called Progressive. I talked to an agent and they send me a copy of verification of my policy. BTW Progressive was absolutely helpful in this situation, I give them 5 stars. However, in the meanwhile a real person (Ms. Ann Purity) was available behind the counter and I showed her the document on my phone. She insisted that I need to have ‚ÄúCollision‚Äù. I never had an argument like that when I picked up a rental car, so I asked her, why do I need this coverage when my insurance covers rental cars? So she is getting upset and aggressive with me, tells me that I don¬¥t get the car when I have no coverage for ‚ÄúCollision‚Äù on my policy. With other words, she is threatening me - if I don¬¥t buy the extra insurance - I don¬¥t get my car. It was a very bad experience dealing with this agent because she used the leverage, no insurance no car. So what can I do? Nothing, because I need a car for my vacation. So I paid for this ridiculous scam $ 167.00. And what did I get? An old damaged and dirty Nissan Sentra.                Yes, they had one of the lowest prices online and that‚Äôs how they lure you in. And screw their customers while they have no alternative. This situation was extremely frustrating, especially when you on vacation. So do yourself a favor and go to a rental car agency with a good reputation.
Fast and nice service, brand new car rented for 8 days. Quick and trouble-free return, deposit unlocked within a few hours. ACE Wroclaw - I recommend

Was given a price on rental car through price line. Went to the agent and he said, " you can't rent a car, snow storm in the forecast. Colorado law requires chains and you will get fined for not having chains. You must upgrade to a SUV. ". He pointed to a big sign on the wall. Then it was the insurance.. "you have to have insurance". I asked wasn't that in our original price? " No you have to pay more coverage , what you paid isn't enough"... I just bit my tongue, initialed all the agreements, put in my credit card and silently seethed my way out to the vehicle.

DO NOT RENT FROM THIS COMPANY. This is not just a case of poor service; it is a systematic scam designed to drain your bank account through fraudulent damage claims and a confusing web of shell companies.The Scheme:1. Identity Confusion: We booked through ACE, but upon arrival, the office operated under a completely different name.2. The "Ghost" Charge: A third, unrelated company handles the security deposit. They reserve a large sum 5600 PLN about 1500 EUR, which is then automatically deducted without your consent.3. Fake Damage Reports: Shortly after returning the car, a fourth company sends a fabricated damage report, referencing an obscure insurance provider to give the scam a veneer of legitimacy.4. Zero Accountability: Once they have your money, their customer service goes completely silent. They do not answer emails, calls, or disputes.Final Verdict:They rely on the complexity of multiple company names to make it impossible for you to track down who is responsible. It is a calculated trap. Save yourself the stress and the money‚Äîbook with a reputable, transparent agency instead.
Great customer service
SCAM!!! THEY DON'T RETURN THE DEPOSIT

Outrageous! 1800 euro stolen by Ace Rent a carcar hire on 24/12/25, not told 1800 euro deposit would be taken from account, but taken. Car returned fine, have pictures and confirmation. Now 10th Feb 2026, still no 1800 Euro deposit back and company often don't reply, they have said 'it will be paid back next week three times'. I have given deadline which they have ignored. Wrong pickup location details at Naples Airport, late driver arrival, very far off-site and many other problems. 3 hours of time lost, and now I have to fly to Italy and report to police. Fraud reported to bankWorst by far of all the past 30 car hires I have done in Europe in the last ten years

My experience with ACE Rent A Car was extremely disappointing and felt like a complete rip off. They charged and withheld my full deposit of 3,500 PLN for a microscopic stone chip on the windscreen of about 1√ó1 mm with no cracks or structural damage. This clearly falls under normal wear and tear.What makes this even worse is that video from 27 January, the day I had the vehicle, already shows this chip, which I documented with screenshot. Keeping a full deposit for pre existing, normal wear and tear is completely unacceptable.Sent few emails to customer service - NO RESPONSEJUST AVOID THEM .. SCAMMERS.

Avoid renting from this company, particularly at Katowice Airport, Poland. After returning the vehicle, I was charged 4,500 PLN from my security deposit for alleged minor cosmetic marks. No proper evidence of an actual repair was provided, as the funds were deducted from my credit card the same day‚Äîwithout a VAT invoice or an independent assessment, only an internal estimate. Fabricated images of a scratched clock dashboard were presented, and despite my immediate dispute and formal written notice, the company refused any refund. After numerous calls, I finally managed to reach them, but the representatives were uncooperative and refused to provide any sensible information. They claimed that I have my own insurance, so I would be reimbursed anyway. This situation is highly suspicious and should be avoided. Huge Scammers ! ! !

Crooked. When we were driving our rental on the highway in Florida, a rock was shot from the car ahead and left a small knick in the windshield. Nothing was said upon returning the car by staff. When we got home, they sent us an over $2000 usd bill to replace the whole windshield. Absolutely ridiculous to replace the whole windshield for something that minor. A bunch of scam artists

From the pick up at the airport I was greeted by Fitzum. Professional and polite. Fitzum helped me load and unload my suitcase. I was greeted by Lulia inside and she was a warm friendly face. I paid in Hotwire $55 for 2 days but I got charged for 3 days. Big problem at the final billing. I had prepaid $532, which they received (verified by them)  the total bill including all extras was $572, but the company charged an additional $131, instead of $40. I was told that no matter the actual money received in prepayment, it was only credited as whatever they charge for basic rental, in this case $441. So I paid them $532, but they were only giving me $441 toward my final bill. Despite the nonsense of this, they refused to budge, and I was forced into the long paperwork process of disputing the overcharge. My guess is they do this all the time, so if you rent from them make sure when you drop off, you're credited for your full pre-payment.

Extremely disappointing experience with OSEK RENT A CAR / ACE.After returning the vehicle, I was charged 2,586 PLN from my security deposit for alleged minor cosmetic marks. No proper evidence of an actual repair was provided ‚Äî no VAT invoice, no independent assessment ‚Äî only an internal estimate.Despite immediate dispute and a formal written notice, the company refused any refund.The situation was resolved only after initiating a bank chargeback, which resulted in a full refund.This kind of deposit handling creates unnecessary stress and raises serious concerns about transparency and fairness.If you rent here, protect yourself:Take extensive photos/videos at pick-up and returnKeep all documentationBe prepared to challenge unjustified charges through your bankI would not recommend this company based on my experience.

Don't rent from them!!!  they assured me I had a vehicle.  I called the day before arriving on Maui to once again check.   I was assured yet again, they had my car.  Then waited at the airport for the shuttle only to be told that they didn't have a car for me.  Don't do it.

We rented a car from ACE Rent a Car from Fort Lauderdale for one week. We reserve the car on Expedia with guaranteed price. We bought our own SunPass for toll roads in Florida which works perfectly for previous rentals. The ACE front desk told us that our SunPass will not work for their vehicles. He said we need to pay $69 in addition for "unlimited toll use," or we will be heavily penalized if we cross toll roads by accident. Then he said, "Sometimes the SunPass works" on their rental car. We struggle for 20 minutes and couldn't register their rental car based on all correct information. I believe it's a hidden scheme for ACE to make extra money. There is no way we can rev up $69 in toll as we are only visiting the Everglades and Key West. Please ask around: ACE needs to be transparent with their "required SunPass toll fee" upfront in their website. If we knew they charge extra, we would have rented from Hertz which allows use of our own SunPass (I asked their front desk upon leaving) and is equally priced or cheaper after the added fee.

Unprofessional and misleading rental experience ‚Äì not recommendedWe booked and paid online for a Nissan Qashqai (or similar) with full AXA insurance, suitable for a family of five.At pickup, we were pressured to buy additional insurance despite already having full coverage.Instead of the booked vehicle, we were given a Toyota Yaris, clearly not comparable in size. After walking in the snow with children and luggage, it became obvious the car was unsuitable and unsafe.Only after requesting cancellation did a Toyota RAV4 suddenly become available, with an extra charge demanded.The replacement car was handed over in the dark, without inspection or documentation.At return, no inspection was done, yet days later we received damage claims for issues that did not occur, and the deposit was blocked for an excessive period.Overall, this felt like a systematic lack of transparency and pressure-based conduct.We do not recommend renting from ACE, especially at Warsaw Chopin Airport.

My Ace rental car experience in Palm Springs was the smoothest and most efficient I have had, and the people were very pleasant!  I say this after hundreds of rentals in dozens of cities.Ace at Palm Springs Airport.

Las Vegas. Rented a car through Ace Cars. Purchased Insurance through 3rd Party and also have Insurance coverage on my Auto Owners Policy. The lady at the Rental Counter even told me I had Insurance already. She advised me to initial the blocks on the small screen. She folded the Rental Agreement and put in a Folder. I did not realize she had added additional Insurance until I seen it posted to my Credit Card. Review your Rental Agreement before signing. They are professionals at scamming money out of their customers. Also, there will be miscellaneous Charges on your final Bill. Some I have never heard of. Do yourself a favor and Rent from a Name Brand Company. Learned a valuable Lesson on this one.

Below 1 exactly 0 would be the score- absolute charlatans and lied about charges being refundable and had just been put in there- a first time car hirer and now going legal on this lot of absolute rogues, going to Florida state for unfair acts now

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT ever in your life rent a car from Ace Rental especially at the Atlanta airport. The company has poor customer service hidden fees and most of all running a complete scam. I was charge $1243.32 for traveling out of the region in which I knew nothing of or was informed of a regional travel policy during my booking at the rental counter. Customer Care and the Rental agents are a total joke. I have reasoned with them explaining I was never informed or aware of the travel policy. Customer Care and the Rental agent at the Atlanta Airport states their policy No Refund No Waiver. It appears customer care and the rental agents are receiving bonus incentives on those customers who was excessively penalized. Not only was I penalized for $1000.00 the greedy scammers had the nerve to tax me on the penalty which increases the fine. I had asked if I can get the additional tax refunded and was told by Gina a big NO.. Customer Care and the Rental agents identical  telemarketing scripts responses are nonchalant, unconcerned most of all unbothered. Both Customer Care and The Rental agents are heavy on the policy No REFUND NO WAIVER end of discussion.As logical or reasonable I'd attempted to explain at no time customer care not even pretend to resolve the situation. I agreed to an upgrade and shouldn‚Äôt have.  I rented a compact SUV their website shows Nissan Kick or similar. The agent told me I‚Äôd upgrade to something larger.  I was tired from my flight and didn‚Äôt register that my upgrade was to a Nissan Kick.  Upon return I requested a refund for an upgrade I didn‚Äôt get.  I was told that the 2026 Kick they gave me was an upgrade.  WHAT??? The body style is slightly different, but definitely not an upgrade.  $154 extra for the same car.  I told the agent this was dishonest and shameful!  The staff is friendly, but the business practices are dishonest!
Poor customer service.  Vehicles old and in need of maintenance.  Hidden charges upon return of vehicle.

2.5 stars because car was good and reliable. But otherwise a very poor customer experience. First, they needed proof of my auto insurance when I arrived to pick up, but hadn't said so ahead of time. I didn't happen to have the latest with me and had to get on line to my co. to show the proof. (I later rented from Hertz in same place and was never asked this.) The clerk I was dealing with --at a screen in their pick-up office, not in-person-- was very machinistic, unhelpful and impersonal. Clerks in the room were probably overworked, but they were also very impersonal. (Very poor customer service.) The customers after me had the same difficulties and went elsewhere rather than resolving it there. When I needed to extend the rental due to illness that made me unable to fly, they charged an extra $20/day for each day it was extended - thus doubling the original price. A one-time fee would be understandable, but each day?! When I later rented from Hertz for a few days, and then also had to extend that car, there was no fee for extending; in fact, the price went down because they automatically changed me to the better weekly rate... and Hertz' customer service was very pleasant and helpful.However, the car at Ace was new, good, clean and reliable. I was completely happy with the car. But I would never do business with this company again if I could in any way avoid it.
Worst service by ace rent a car, they showed on the website caddilac or similar, went to pick car gave Nissan, like Toyota 4 runner never renting car from ace Dubai location
They took 3 hours to give us our car after we checked in and the car sucks broke down within 5 minutes never renting from them ever again

I chose Ace for a week-long rental because they had the cheapest rates in Manchester. When I returned the car I found out why. After seven days' incident-free driving, they spotted three tiny dents to the bodywork and a scratch to the rear bumper. By 'tiny',  I mean barely visible (at least not to me when I took the car out!). When they forwarded me the photos, they added a helpful 'zebra' effect to make things clearer - along with an invoice for just south of ¬£1,000. Luckily my insurers picked up the tab, but it was a lesson learnt. I'm not saying don't hire from these guys - just be aware of their business model, inspect every inch of the car and have your insurer on speed dial.

An absolute rip off - very rude and horrible service and deliberately trying to overcharge. . Both to us and to another couple renting a car, not to mention an elderly gentleman who got abused. Do not use for any reason.  (Apparently changed name from ‚ÄúTarget‚Äù to ‚ÄúAce‚Äù)

I rented a car from October 29 - November 5.It is December 26 today, and I just received an email from them that they charged my card for $77 USD for parking violation. $50 of the $77 is admin fee!This is unacceptable. I expect a full refund!

DO NOT USE ACE RENTAL CARSFormal complaint ACE RENTAL CARSSubject: Complaint ‚Äì Unsafe Vehicle & Unauthorized SLI Charge ‚Äì ACE Rental Car at FLLIssues with the vehicle:I was given a car with a non‚Äëfunctional horn.(safety issue)The Bluetooth in the vehicle did not work.These issues affected both safety (no horn) and basic functionality (no Bluetooth), and the car should not have been on the road in that condition.Unauthorized SLI charge:At the counter, I was offered Supplemental Liability Insurance (SLI).I clearly refused SLI multiple times (at least five times).I was bullied by the agent how i needed it even after refusal (i'm sure they get commision for all add ons)Despite this, SLI was added to my rental and I was charged for it.I am disputing this SLI charge as unauthorized and contrary to my explicit refusal.Customer care experience:I called customer care to resolve the issue and was told more time was needed to ‚Äúrefute‚Äù the charge. that he had to contact that location and wait for an unspecified time for their response and or refusal.I had already waited two days just to reach someone by phone.chat service and phone service gave two different Reponses for why the charge was there and unable to be disputed. Shady practice.When I asked to speak with a manager/supervisor, my request for escalation was refused. and they hung up and had the audacity to ask for a review of the service call.This is unacceptable, especially given that the underlying issue is an unsafe vehicle and an insurance product I did not consent to purchase.
Matt was great and helped make our experience better. He had a great attitude and listened throughout the whole process. Only feedback, I wish the pickup shuttles ran more frequently.

I will not rent from this company again and would not recommend it to family or friends. Decent value if you lower your expectations. The car had high mileage but ran fine. Be aware of the large security deposit hold on your credit card, which can take weeks to release. Thoroughly inspect the vehicle for scratches before driving off to avoid unfair charges.

Very poor customer service I got into an accident on Oct 27, 2025 someone hit me from behind while driving on the highway The police was called and  the rental car company inform of the accident, they let me know that this will be taken care of once I return the vehicle.I returned the vehicle and gave them the incident report from the police of the accident. I spoke with several people concerning this matter, customer service at 1877-822-3872 and 1844-874-3966 which they said was the corporate office I spoke to a Dave C., a Jordan and I also spoke with the manager lucky at the Miami airport location with no resolution at all they gave me a number that was supposed to be to the claims department the first number they gave me was 361-450-1926 you couldn't even leave a message at this number the voicemail said leave a message, however the mailbox is full so you can't leave a message. it's been full for a month and a half, so I call back and  was given  a different phone number 210-403-2336 and I left numerous  messages on this answer machine and noone has yet to get back to me. I fill like I'm on a hamster wheel just going in circles. Im still waiting on a call or an email

We had a reservation at Ace Rent-A-Car that was booked through Priceline.  We went to pick up the car at Newark International Airport, and the young woman representative refused to rent the car to my husband as he didn't have our insurance information.  I was waiting outside, and I went back inside to tell the representative that I had the insurance information on my phone.  The employee who refused to rent the car to my husband had left, and a young man was at the desk.  When I explained that I had the insurance information on my phone, he told me that the reservation had already been cancelled. He told me there would be no charge.  A few weeks later, the charge appeared on my credit card.   I was unsuccessful in reaching Priceline to speak to anyone.  When the phone prompted me to use my reservation number, the response was that there was no reservation with that number. I had spent many hours trying to call Ace and Priceline, and finally I decided to dispute the charge with my credit card company.  Now they are saying that because I went through my credit card company, I can't get a refund.  Buyers beware when renting through Priceline and Ace Rent-A-Car.

I rented a car in Warsaw through ACE Rent A Car, operated locally by OSEK Rent A Car. After returning the vehicle, I was unexpectedly charged for an alleged windshield damage ‚Äì without any valid or verifiable proof.Here is exactly what happened:There were no clear, dated photos of the windshield at pickup, so the company cannot prove the car was undamaged before the rental.The so-called ‚Äúdamage photos‚Äù taken at return were made in the dark, without context, and do not show any identifiable damage.The company did not provide an official workshop invoice, only a self-generated ‚Äúestimate‚Äù for 5,320 PLN.I immediately disputed the claim because no evidence supports it, and the burden of proof lies with the rental company.A VISA chargeback and formal complaints with European and Polish consumer authorities have already been initiated.After reading the reviews here and on Google, it is clear that this is not an isolated incident. Many customers report the same pattern: unjustified post-rental charges and questionable damage claims.Conclusion:I strongly advise against renting from ACE / OSEK in Warsaw. Their handling of damage claims is opaque, unprofessional, and appears to follow a recurring pattern. There are many reputable rental companies in Warsaw ‚Äì unfortunately, this is not one of them.
